definition: to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
to scrape/to blow/to shave/to plunder/to extort

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: He bent over to scrape some dirt off his shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他弯腰刮掉鞋子上的尘土。

sentences.english: You could shave off as many as half the calories.
sentences.chinese: 你可以刮掉多达一半的热量。

sentences.english: The other stain is hard. It has to be scraped away with a scaler.
sentences.chinese: 其他染色的部分硬的，要用刮除器把他刮掉。

sentences.english: Use a box knife to continue to shave off the old tip.
sentences.chinese: 使用手工刀继续刮掉先角上剩余的老皮头。

sentences.english: Would you like me to shave off your beard?
sentences.chinese: 要我把您的络腮胡子刮掉吗？

sentences.english: Guru Saj: It got caught on my watch.
It even scraped off the product's name where it appeared below the samples.
sentences.chinese: 三星甚至刮掉了样品下的产品名称。

sentences.english: Mind you, don't catch that cup with your elbow.
sentences.chinese: 留神你的胳臂肘别刮掉了那只茶杯。

sentences.english: He scraped away the wallpaper and found paneling underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他刮掉糊墙纸，看到了里面的镶板。

sentences.english: He scraped the paint from the surface.
A roll automatically scrapes the dried wax off the surface of the hole table, pushing it into a bin at the end.
sentences.chinese: 阿滚自动刮掉表面的孔表干蜡，推入一本在末尾。

sentences.english: I scraped the skin off the vegetables with a knife.
sentences.chinese: 使用手工刀继续刮掉先角上剩余的老皮头。

sentences.english: All the leaves have been ripped away from the trees by the high wind.
sentences.chinese: 大风把树上的叶子都刮掉了。

sentences.english: She shaved the hairs off her legs.
Use it to scrape off the excess cream cheese and mayo.
sentences.chinese: 用它来刮掉过多的奶油芝士和梅奥。

sentences.english: The wind raved through the trees and dismantled the trees of their leaves.
sentences.chinese: 风呼啸着刮过树林，把树叶刮掉了。

definition: to scrape/to blow/to shave/to plunder/to extort
to tear out (and throw away)/to rip away
to get rid of/to exclude/to eliminate/to remove/to delete/to strip out/to extract
to cut off/to cut away/to trim
to scrape the meat from bones/to pick (teeth etc)/to weed out
